intro: Microlophium exile, commonly known as the slender water shield, is a small aquatic plant native to North America. It typically grows in shallow freshwater environments such as ponds and slow-moving streams. The plant has narrow, ribbon-like leaves that float on the water surface, with roots submerged in the substrate. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, usually greenish-white in color. Microlophium exile plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for small aquatic organisms.
